news_header: The discovery of a 161 million-year-old tadpole fossil in Patagonia reveals that modern tadpole characteristics evolved much earlier than previously thought.
news_text: Researchers have found a fossilized tadpole of Notobatrachus degiustoi in Patagonia, dating back 161 million years, pushing back the record for the earliest known tadpoles by 30 million years. The well-preserved fossil shows that tadpoles had already developed filter-feeding traits similar to modern species. This discovery indicates that the evolutionary strategy of filter-feeding in tadpoles has been stable for a long time. The fossil tadpole was significantly larger than many modern tadpoles, measuring about 16 centimeters.
